events.description: Check in at residence hall before stopping by the Welcome Center

events.title: Welcome Centers Open for all music majors, Passage, International and Passport Students
events.description: Register for Orientation
events.location: Phelps Room & Fireside Lounge, Beamer Center

events.title: Music Major Orientation Meeting
events.description: Meet the faculty, learn more about ensembles, touring, and more.

events.title: Residence Halls open for all new students
events.description: Meet your new roommate! Check in at residence hall before stopping by the Welcome Center

events.title: Welcome Centers Open
events.description: Register for Orientation.
events.location: Phelps Room & Fireside Lounge, Beamer Center

events.title: New Student ID Pictures
events.description: Those who did not send in ID photos must go to Public Safety to have their picture taken.

events.title: Ancient Languages Placement Test
events.description: Advance registration is required

events.title: Mandarin Chinese Placement Test
events.description: Advance registration is required

events.title: Disability Services Meeting
events.description: Open for all new students interested in learning about the resources available for those with special needs (learning, physical and emotional).

events.title: Alumni Reception and Photo
events.description: Reception for alumni families and their new students with President Ryken. Group photographs of children or grandchildren of Wheaton alumni taken at 5:00 pm.

events.title: OPENING PROGRAM
events.description: A welcome and dedication program for new students and families, with administrators, the Orientation Committee and other guests.

events.title: Residence Hall Floor Socials
events.description: Meet other students from your floor while celebrating your first day at Wheaton!

events.title: Your calling as a student
events.description: Learn how Wheaton is committed to your personal formation as a student, the liberal arts experience, student care, calling and career, and beyond.

events.title: Pre-Professional Sessions
events.description: Education - Blanchard 339, Law - MSC 302, Health - Science 145
events.location: Education - Blanchard 339, Law - MSC 302, Health - Science 145

events.title: Lunch in Anderson Commons
events.description: Lunch served inside with additional seating outside on Soderquist Plaza

events.title: Meet the Profs - Department Fair
events.description: Meet Faculty and learn about their department's curriculum, programs and general resources for students

events.title: Res Life ExtRAvaganza
events.description: Get to know the RAs on campus and learn some of the essentials of living in the Residence Halls at Wheaton.

events.title: Worship with Others
events.description: Attend a local church of your choosing. A directory of churches is provided in the residence halls.

events.title: A Slice of Wheaton
events.description: Meet your ChicaGO Community Service Day Group and your GO Leader and enjoy a "a slice of Wheaton" for Sunday dinner.

events.title: Community Service Day Preview
events.description: Hear about Monday's Community Service Day.

events.title: Residence Hall Bro-Sis Socials
events.description: Don't miss the opportunity to gather together as bro-sis floors and start building friendships.

events.title: ChicaGO Community Service Day
events.description: Serve with your GO Group in the City of Chicago!

events.title: Quantitative Skills Test
events.description:
The Quantitative Skills Test is required of all students EXCEPT those who have received an AP Calculus AB score of 3, 4, or 5 OR an AP Calculus BC score of 2, 3, 4, or 5 OR an IB HL score of 5 or greater OR those who will either pass one of the following courses at Wheaton or transfer in credit for one of the following: MATH 218 – Introduction to Calculus with Precalculus (4)
 MATH 221 – Applied 
Calculus (4) 
 MATH 231 – Calculus I (4) 
 MATH 232 – Calculus II (4)
 Come prepared with sharpened pencils and a calculator.

events.title: All School Rehearsal and Class Meeting
events.description: Hear from Student Government about getting involved on campus and practice your class song in preparation for singing together at All School Communion tonight.

events.title: "All School" - Worship
events.description: All students come to worship together for the first time as a student body.

events.title: Classes begin today
events.description: Serve with your GO Group in the City of Chicago!

events.title: Mandatory floor meetings
events.location: Information will be posted in your residence.

events.title: Part-Time Student Job Fair
events.description: See what options are available for a part-time job on or off campus.
events.location: Beamer Center, Upper Level, Coray Gym

events.title: Organizations Fair
events.description: Find out about all the groups on campus and how you can get involved.
events.location: Soderquist Plaza, Coray Gym rain site
